(6) 
I could to note such matters as may 
give the Society a just notion of the 
states of every Month at that place, 
& y<sup>t<\sup> which was most observeable in 
it. I could wish y<sup>t<\sup> either the Society, 
or I my self, could have had some 
Observations in the more Southerly 
parts, to have tallied w<sup>th<\sup> these. 
Appendix to the foregoing Observations, 
being 
<u>Meteorological Observations<\u> at <u>Lunden<\u> in <u>Swe-
den<zu> in the year 1724, w<sup>ch<\sup> tally w<sup>th<\sup> <u>M<sup>r<\sup> Consetts<\u>. 
These observations not coming to hand till I
had finished those at <u>Petersburgh<\u>, I am forced 
to subjoyn them by way of Appendix. And the 
1. Observation I shall make, shall be of the 
Range of the [alchemical mercury symbol] in the barometer, w<sup>ch<\sup> seems 
to be different in both places, as far as I 
can judge of the matter, by the few Obser-
vations that tally with one another, w<sup>ch<\sup> is only <s>[text?]<\s> 
from Dec: 18<sup>th<\sup> to the end of that month <u>M<sup>r<\sup> Consett<\u>'s 
Barom-
